aboutSpatium.title: About SPATIUM
aboutSpatium.text: SPATIUM – the Research Center for Technological Support and Information – is based at the Faculty of Computers, Informatics, and Microelectronics (FCIM) of the Technical University of Moldova (UTM). Our center is dedicated to fighting human trafficking and modern slavery by harnessing the power of digital innovation and collaborative research.

ourMission.title: Our Mission
ourMission.text: At SPATIUM, we aim to develop advanced technological tools and provide accurate information that help prevent and reduce the risks associated with human trafficking. With human trafficking on the rise globally, we believe that immediate action is essential. Through our research and innovative projects, we are committed to raising awareness and equipping communities with the solutions they need to combat this grave issue.

whatWeDo.title: What We Do
list: Innovation through Collaboration: In partnership with international organizations such as the Dutch National Police and media outlets like “Ziarul de Gardă”, we bring together experts from academia, law enforcement, and the tech industry.

Hackathons and Workshops: Our hackathons serve as dynamic forums where developers, researchers, and industry professionals brainstorm and build digital prototypes aimed at alerting communities and empowering journalists.
Research and Development: We actively engage in projects like “ESCAPEVAN MOLDOVA,” which have already shown significant societal impact by creating practical, user-friendly technological solutions.

ourTeam.title: Our Team
ourTeam.text: Led by Professor Dumitru CIORBĂ, Mariana CATRUC and Gabriel ZAHARIA, we strive to foster a culture of innovation and social responsibility through our research initiatives and partnerships.

ourVision.title: Our Vision
ourVision.text: We envision a future where technology is the driving force behind social change — a future where digital tools and reliable information help build safer communities and a more informed society. By combining academic excellence, international collaboration, and cutting-edge research, SPATIUM is at the forefront of transforming ideas into solutions that make a real difference.

history.title: Our History
history.p1: Following the adoption of the Protocol to Prevent, Suppress and Punish Trafficking in Persons, Especially Women and Children (2000), under the UN Convention against Transnational Organized Crime, the concept of human trafficking emerged. This crime, considered a severe form of corruption, occurs when a person receives or requests money, influence, or other goods, or accepts promises or gifts to use their influence over others.
history.p2_1: To actively contribute to combating human trafficking,
history.p2_3: laid the foundation for the Spatium Human Trafficking Research Center. This center focuses on designing technical innovations and providing support to counteract this serious crime. Its activities include technical innovation for event organization and the collection of relevant data on the human trafficking phenomenon.
history.p3: SPATIUM aims to engage in international collaboration with other research centers across Europe working on related dimensions, focusing on offering advanced technological support, information, awareness, and research to prevent and reduce human trafficking.
history.partnerships: The center collaborates with various organizations and institutions to achieve its goals. For example, during the hackathon against human trafficking held on November 24–25, 2023, the Spatium Human Trafficking Research Center was supported by the Dutch National Police, Ziarul de Gardă, Internews, Hope4, and OGK (Open Gate Kitchen). Additionally, the NGO FAF played an essential role in organizing the event.
history.academic: Center members are actively involved in researching the phenomenon of human trafficking. For instance, at a national scientific conference with international participation in November 2024, they presented papers analyzing the techno-socio-cultural projections of the humanitarian crisis, highlighting the link between such crises and vulnerability to human trafficking.
history.education: Besides research and technological development, the center places great emphasis on public education and raising awareness of the risks and consequences of human trafficking. Through information sessions, workshops, and collaboration with NGOs, the Spatium Human Trafficking Research Center helps increase community awareness and builds a support network for victims of this phenomenon.
